etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, "eye") + 人(人) (rén, "person") — a person looking back
etymology.interpretation: The character captures the idea of a person looking back, suggesting the notions of stopping or being aware of limits. This visual cue makes the meaning intuitive, tying a person’s gaze to the concepts of halting or disobedience.

examples.chinese: 我们要艮住自己的欲望(我們要艮住自己的慾望)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yào gèn zhù zìjǐ de yùwàng.
examples.english: We need to stop our desires.

examples.chinese: 这条路艮了(這條路艮了)。
